title.english: The Irregular at Magic High School Season 3

description:
The third season of Mahouka Koukou no Rettousei.

After the battle against The New Breed Front, Tatsuya and Miyuki enter the new "Magic Engineering Department."

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: พี่น้องปริศนาโรงเรียนมหาเวท ภาค 3

node.description:
**[Profile (Office Without)](http://www.officewithout.com/iwasaki.html)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/taque68)** | **[MySpace](https://myspace.com/taqueiwasaki)** | **[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/soundtrack-maker)**

A composer and musician generally known for his jazz-like scores.

When he was 3 years old he was given a piano, he was also taken to Yamaha Music School, where he first came into contact with music. He quit music school as an elementary school student and, until his high school years, studied under Iwashita Tetsuya, who taught him how to use multiple recordings and synthesizers. He became a composer in his later high school years, through the various efforts made by himself and his teacher.

In 1985, he won a prize at the Kanagawa Arts Festival choral composition competition, while in the late 1980s, after entering Tokyo University of the Arts, he studied contemporary music under Satou Shin and Aoshima Hiroshi. While still being a student, he received the New Artist Award from the Japan Contemporary Music Association. He later started working as an arranger after graduating from college.

In 1999, he participated in the music unit "Smart Drug" with Koizumi Hiroshi, who was responsible for doing the composition and playing the guitar, and Okamoto Sayori who would later rename to Hiyoko, who was responsible for doing the lyrics and vocals. He participated under the alias "Taque," where he was responsible for the arrangement and playing the keyboard. They released three CDs from 1999 to 2002.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Website](http://www.lxixsxa.com/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/lxixsxa/) | [Profile (Anison)](http://anison.info/data/person/29206.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/LiSA_OLiVE) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/xlisa_olivex/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/lisaSMEJ) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/lxixsxa.jp) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA_(Japanese_musician,_born_1987)) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA)

LiSA is a Japanese singer, songwriter and lyricist from Seki, Gifu. LiSA started her own band while in high school to catch a growing wave of punk rock. In 2008, she moved to Tokyo in order to further her musical career. The name "LiSA" stands for "Love is Same All" or "LiVE is Smile Always."

She announced her marriage to voice actor and singer [Tatsuhisa Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/95735/Tatsuhisa-Suzuki) on January 22, 2020.
Kimura Kashiko is an editor working for Mad Box.

[Website](http://www.lxixsxa.com/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/lxixsxa/) | [Profile (Anison)](http://anison.info/data/person/29206.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/LiSA_OLiVE) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/xlisa_olivex/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/lisaSMEJ) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/lxixsxa.jp) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA_(Japanese_musician,_born_1987)) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA)

LiSA is a Japanese singer, songwriter and lyricist from Seki, Gifu. LiSA started her own band while in high school to catch a growing wave of punk rock. In 2008, she moved to Tokyo in order to further her musical career. The name "LiSA" stands for "Love is Same All" or "LiVE is Smile Always."

She announced her marriage to voice actor and singer [Tatsuhisa Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/95735/Tatsuhisa-Suzuki) on January 22, 2020.

__Likes:__ Fried Chicken and Clams
__Dislikes:__ Tomatoes and Natto

__Introduction:__
Tomoya Tabuchi is a Japanese musician, lyricist, bassist, composer and arranger. He is in charge of the bass and chorus for the three-piece rock band [UNISON SQUARE GARDEN](https://anilist.co/staff/119406/Unison-Square-Garden), and for the rock band [THE KEBABS](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/THE_KEBABS), he also takes part in the [Q-MHz](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Q-MHz) music production team.

__Biography:__
Tomoya is the same age as the two other UNISON SQUARE GARDEN members, Kousuke Saito (斎藤宏介) who is also a high school and university classmate, and Suzuki Takao (鈴木貴雄) who is an elementary school classmate. In elementary school, he was obsessed with soccer, to the point that he'd become a "soccer boy". His future dream at the time, was to become a junior league soccer player. Band member Suzuki Takao participated in the same soccer club, as well. When he was in fifth grade of elementary school, he had to move from Funabashi City, Chiba to Setagaya-ku, Tokyo due to his father's work.

In later years he graduated from the Faculty of Political Science and Economics at Waseda University. His specialized field is finance theory.

__Dislikes:__ Tomatoes and Natto

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kemu8888)**

**Horie Shouta** is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger, bassist, pianoist and member of the five-piece rock band [PENGUIN RESEARCH](https://anilist.co/staff/120093).
